alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:53AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT DUBOIS COUNTY THROUGH 230 AM EDT... At 153 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jasper, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Huntingburg, Ferdinand, Holland, Birdseye, Dubois, Celestine, Saint Marks, Portersville and Millersport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
